p:
Two highly ranked barriers in combined regions arise from the multiple uses and anthropogenic factors affecting rural and wild landscapes: “Pressure from other land uses” (ranked fourth overall and first in Alaska) and “Understanding the combined effects of climate change and other factors” (ranked sixth) (Fig. 3). Interview participants also emphasized these factors:
There’s a very much acknowledged focus on climate change that’s affecting Alaskan resources. Where it breaks down…is…in the consideration of the additional or cumulative factors that [with] climate change may exacerbate sensitivity of wild lands.
~Federal agency employee, Arctic Alaska
